```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)
```

## Read csv files
```{r}
championTbl <- read.csv("archive/ChampionTbl.csv")
itemTbl<- read.csv("archive/ItemTbl.csv")
matchStatsTbl <- read.csv("archive/MatchStatsTbl.csv")
matchTbl <- read.csv("archive/MatchTbl.csv")
RankTbl <- read.csv("archive/RankTbl.csv")
SummonerMatchTbl <- read.csv("archive/SummonerMatchTbl.csv")
TeamMatchTbl <- read.csv("archive/TeamMatchTbl.csv")


```

## View datasets
```{r}
glimpse(championTbl)
glimpse(itemTbl)
glimpse(matchStatsTbl)
glimpse(matchTbl)
glimpse(RankTbl)
glimpse(SummonerMatchTbl)
glimpse(TeamMatchTbl)
```

## Including Plots

Create a new table that combines 



```{r}
itemTbl %>% 
  filter(ItemID == "2055")
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
